title: ExcitationCalibration
description: This element describes a procedure used to measure and calibrate the Wavelength and Irradiance of the Excitation Light Source used to Acquire this experimental Image.

subCategoriesOrder.IntensityCalibration: This describes the procedure(s) that were used for excitation and detector calibration and the resulting calibration results.
subCategoriesOrder.ExcitationCalibration: This element describes a procedure used to measure and calibrate the Wavelength and Irradiance of the Excitation Light Source used to Acquire this experimental Image.
subCategoriesOrder.IntensityCalibrationTool: This element is a reference to the tool if any used to perform this calibratin procdure
subCategoriesOrder.IntensityCalibrationReport: This element refers to any File containing a report generated by the Calibration Software referred to in Calibration procedure.

ObservedEx-Wavelength.description: This field records the observed Peak Excitation Wavelength at the Back Objective as measured by using this Calibration Procedure.

ObservedPowerAtObjective.description: This field records the observed Excitation Light Power at the Back Objective as measured by using this Calibration Procedure.

ObservedPowerAtSample.description: This field records the observed Excitation Light Power at the Sample (i.e., Front of the Objective) as measured by using this Calibration Procedure.

ShortTermIlluminationStability.description: According to ISO 21073:2019, Illumination Stability is defined as the percentage deviation of Minimum and Maximum Illumination Powers from the Average Power during the time interval considered. Specifically, SATB [%] = 100x {1-[(Pmax-Pmin)/Pmax+Pmin]}, where Pmax is the maximum laser power recorded during the time interval; and Pmin is the minimum laser power recorded during the time interval. This field records the Short Term Illumination Stability recorded during this Calibration Procedure by measuring Illumination Power every second for a time interval of 5 min of continuous illumination.

MediumTermIlluminationStability.description: According to ISO 21073:2019, Illumination Stability is defined as the percentage deviation of Minimum and Maximum Illumination Powers from the Average Power during the time interval considered. Specifically, SATB [%] = 100x {1-[(Pmax-Pmin)/Pmax+Pmin]}, where Pmax is the maximum laser power recorded during the time interval; and Pmin is the minimum laser power recorded during the time interval. This field records the Medium Term Illumination Stability recorded during this Calibration Procedure by measuring Illumination Power every 30 s for one second for a time interval of 120 min of continuous illumination.

LongTermIlluminationStability.description: According to ISO 21073:2019, Illumination Stability is defined as the percentage deviation of Minimum and Maximum Illumination Powers from the Average Power during the time interval considered. Specifically, SATB [%] = 100x {1-[(Pmax-Pmin)/Pmax+Pmin]}, where Pmax is the maximum laser power recorded during the time interval; and Pmin is the minimum laser power recorded during the time interval. This field records the Long Term Illumination Stability recorded during this Calibration Procedure by measuring Illumination Power for one second for a time interval of several weeks or months.

PowerLinearity.description: This field captures the Linear Correlation Coefficient of observed Output Illumination Power response to different input Power settings, as measured at the back of the Objective.

ObservedExcitationIrradiance.description: Observed mean excitation light irradiance (radiant power per unit area) as measured at the sample plane over the Field of View (FOV).

ObservedExcitationVariance.description: Observed excitation light irradiance (radiant power per unit area) variation over the Field of View (FOV).

Date.description: Ths field records the Date in which this Calibration procedure was performed.

Method.description: This field records a Description of Method used for this calibration procedure.
